channel.title: I can't run my source. I always get this error
channel.description:
Ok well, this morning I tried to run my source, but everytime I click on run I get this error in the little black box.
java.net.BindException: Address already in use: JVM_Bind at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketBind(Native Method) at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.bind(Unknown Source) at java.net.ServerSocket.bind(Unknown Source) at java.net.ServerSocket.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.net.ServerSocket.<init>(Unknown Source) at palidino76.rs2.net.SocketListener.<init>(SocketListener.java:45) at palidino76.rs2.Server.main(Server.java:51) Press any key to continue . . .
Could someone help me with that? Thanks in advance.
~ Macoronizer

item.source: I can't run my source. I always get this error

item.title: I can't run my source. I always get this error
item.dc:creator: @Macoronizer Macoronizer
item.description:
@Macoronizer wrote:

Ok, now it says : The System Cannot Find The Path Specified. But, I think I know how to fix it. It’s something to do with the variables ( I think ) This is what I did.

  1. My computer
  2. System Properties
  3. Advance System Settings
  4. Environment Variables
  5. Then I need to make a new variable in user variables for Matt ( that’s my username ) call it PATH and put this in C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin
  6. Then, the same thing for the other, system variables. There, I need to put classpath for the variable name and this CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%; for the variable value

Correct me if I’m wrong, please. :o

Read full topic
item.source: I can't run my source. I always get this error

item.title: I can't run my source. I always get this error
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

Try.

@echo off
cd ../bin
color 40
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_6\bin\java.exe" Server 43594
pause

OR (If there is a DIR called Bulby)

@echo off
cd ../bin/Bulby/
color 40
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_6\bin\java.exe" Server 43594
pause

Read full topic

item.title: I can't run my source. I always get this error
item.dc:creator: @Macoronizer Macoronizer
item.description:
@Macoronizer wrote:

:eek:… I don’t got that error anymore. Thanks alot man, you’re very nice. But now, when I click on run I get this -.-

Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Bulby/Server
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Bulby.Server
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source)
Press any key to continue . . .

What does that means?

Read full topic

item.title: I can't run my source. I always get this error
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

TCP 0.0.0.0:43594 0.0.0.0:0 LISTENING 4320
PID = 4320.

Find the number 4320 now the colum labeled ‘PID’ then right click and press ‘End Proccess’.

Read full topic

item.title: I can't run my source. I always get this error
item.dc:creator: @Macoronizer Macoronizer
item.description:
@Macoronizer wrote:

OK, here is what I get in Command Prompt :

Proto Local Address Foreign Address State PID
TCP 0.0.0.0:135 0.0.0.0:0 LISTENING 912
TCP 0.0.0.0:445 0.0.0.0:0 LISTENING 4
TCP 0.0.0.0:5357 0.0.0.0:0 LISTENING 4
TCP 0.0.0.0:28846 0.0.0.0:0 LISTENING 3876
TCP 0.0.0.0:43594 0.0.0.0:0 LISTENING 4320
TCP 0.0.0.0:49152 0.0.0.0:0 LISTENING 596
TCP 0.0.0.0:49153 0.0.0.0:0 LISTENING 1044

and more… but if I’m not mistaking, I only need the PID part.

Then, when I go on TaskManager

11113223.jpg686×589

So, what do I need to do now ?

Read full topic

item.title: I can't run my source. I always get this error
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

Yes. In Task manager you should see this (Under the proccess tab)

Find the PID and end the proccess.

item.source: I can't run my source. I always get this error

item.title: I can't run my source. I always get this error
item.dc:creator: @Macoronizer Macoronizer
item.description:
@Macoronizer wrote:

Ok wow, hehe. I’m kinda lost.

Use netstat -a -n -o in command prompt, find out which PID is using this port

I did that

Then find the PID in the TaskManager. Kill the proccess

But what you mean by that ? fin the PID in the TaskManager ?

Read full topic
item.source: I can't run my source. I always get this error

item.title: I can't run my source. I always get this error
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

The port(s) the server is attempting to bind to is already in use by some other process.

Use netstat -a -n -o in command prompt, find out which PID is using this port. Then find the PID in the TaskManager. Kill the proccess.

Read full topic
